messages.message: @dlluncor @Chetan @Jesika Haria do you have context around the extra logic in `gen_py3_requirements.py`?  It doesn’t look like there is a similar set up for `requirements.txt`.
As far as I can tell it strips some of the dependencies from the `requirements.txt`, but I can’t see why or how that is decided.

It doesn’t just strip dependencies, it also adds some. Some modules aren’t compatible/are unneeded/have been replaced for py3. For instance, `goose` vs. `goose3`. They are added/removed based on what the engineers figure out is necessary while coding/testing. Is that what you were asking, or is there different context that I’m missing? :grinning:
I think that is part of it. I can’t tell if it is all of it, though
